description: From Middle English, from Old French, from Latin paenitēns, poenitēns (“penitent”), present participle of paeniteō, poeniteō (“I cause to repent; I regret, repent”). Doublet of penitente.

adjectives.description: penitent (comparative more penitent, superlative most penitent)

entries.meaning: Feeling pain or sorrow on account of one's sins or offenses; feeling sincere guilt.
examples: Synonyms: repentant, contrite; see also Thesaurus:remorseful

entries.meaning: One who repents of sin; one sorrowful on account of their transgressions.
One under church censure, but admitted to penance; one undergoing penance.
One under the direction of a confessor.
